    void
    saveEntry(JournalEntry journalEntry, String username)
    First the username is determined from the database User userInDB Second, local time is fetched from the computer or the operating system and pastes in to the setDate field Third, the data is saved into the journal repository itself JournalEntry saved Since there is a list in the user class
    invalid reference 
    User#getJournalEntry()
    , we could use add and a part of reference is shared into the array list Lastly the method is registered into the user database using the UserService.saveEntry(User)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • saveEntry

      public void saveEntry(JournalEntry journalEntry, String username)
      First the username is determined from the database User userInDB Second, local time is fetched from the computer or the operating system and pastes in to the setDate field Third, the data is saved into the journal repository itself JournalEntry saved Since there is a list in the user class
      invalid reference 
      User#getJournalEntry()
      , we could use add and a part of reference is shared into the array list Lastly the method is registered into the user database using the UserService.saveEntry(User)
      Parameters:
      journalEntry - returns the body of the JSON sent from frontend(Postman)
      username - returns a String type username from the URL where it dumps the records in the specific username

    • saveEntry

      public void saveEntry(JournalEntry journalEntry)
      Overloaded method to handle various parameters JournalEntryControllerV2.updateJournalByID(ObjectId, JournalEntry, String)
      Parameters:
      journalEntry - returns the body of the JSON sent from frontend(Postman)
